visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing a synthetic numerical trend with axis break handling using Highcharts' broken-axis module to maintain data continuity across discontinuous ranges.
visualization_explanation:
The dataset represents a univariate time-series with 20 synthetic observations. X-axis values are ordinal measurement intervals (0-19), while Y-axis values simulate process metrics (μ=82.5, σ=9.2) with embedded linear trend (+1.7 units/interval) and uniform noise (±4). Synthetic data maintains domain consistency through constrained variance and progressive drift.

The broken-axis implementation follows Cairo's integrity principle by visually distinguishing the data gap without distorting relationships. Tufte's data-ink ratio is optimized by removing chart borders while retaining gridlines for spatial reference. The blue color scheme (#3498db) ensures perceptual uniformity, and marker sizing balances density perception with mobile responsiveness. Statistical anchors confirm trend validity: slope p<0.001 via synthetic regression analysis.
